answers.answer: It seems to me like you may need to see an ENT. Is there any way you can go back to the VA and see if there is anyway that they can send to one? If you're having dizziness and episodes of fevers, they need to get to the bottom of it and see what's causing it.

Hello and hope you are doing well.The smell, the fever and your other symptoms are due to sinusitis. The sinus needs to drain well for the infection to subside. So, you will need to consult an ENT specialist. More so because you are a diabetic. In the meantime take OTC naproxen for relief from pain, practice good breathing exercises, humidify your room and do steam inhalations.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: If you read in my profile you probably already see what my problems are ..but anyway I am a 59yr old male that does have diabetes that is controlled right now by weight control..and with this sinus problem I have it has remained normal all summer long..but in May I was cutting our grass and when it was time to get off of the mower I became very dizzy and had became feverish and this continues to this day with facial pain in the sinus areas and sinus drainage and episodes of fever. low grade 99.5 and around that area today I awoke to the smell of burnt rubber that will not leave and I am very agitated and my sinus' are draining like crazy along with the fever again and this time it is going above a 100 degrees with bouts of dizziness...I went to the VA hospital and was given antibiotics four different times and on the last round they drew blood and found out that the infection wasn't bacterial and stopped the antibiotics and that is all they have done..I am not the only person in this area that is having these same symptoms with no releif..has anybody got any ideas before I lose all my marbles because the VA will not send me to a ENT dr...please help
title: Sinus infection with fever for over 5 months
